intro: Monogynella lophosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled monogynella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
